tripleplay.game

Interface ScreenStack.Transition

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractTransition, FadeTransition, FlipTransition, InterpedTransition, PageTurnTransition, SlideTransition
    Enclosing class:
    ScreenStack

    public static interface ScreenStack.Transition
    Implements a particular screen transition.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  ScreenStack.Transition.Dir
      Direction constants, used by transitions.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void complete(Screen oscreen, Screen nscreen)
      Called when the transition is complete.
      void init(Screen oscreen, Screen nscreen)
      Allows the transition to pre-compute useful values.
      boolean update(Screen oscreen, Screen nscreen, float elapsed)
      Called every frame to update the transition

    • Method Detail

      • init

        void init(Screen oscreen,
          Screen nscreen)
        Allows the transition to pre-compute useful values. This will immediately be followed by call to update(tripleplay.game.Screen, tripleplay.game.Screen, float) with an elapsed time of zero.

      • update

        boolean update(Screen oscreen,
               Screen nscreen,
               float elapsed)
        Called every frame to update the transition
        Parameters:
        oscreen - the outgoing screen.
        nscreen - the incoming screen.
        elapsed - the elapsed time since the transition started (in millis if that's what your game is sending to ScreenStack.update(int)).
        Returns:
        false if the transition is not yet complete, true when it is complete.

      • complete

        void complete(Screen oscreen,
              Screen nscreen)
        Called when the transition is complete. This is where the transition should clean up any temporary bits and restore the screens to their original state. The stack will automatically destroy/hide the old screen after calling this method. Also note that this method may be called before the transition signals completion, if a new transition is started and this transition needs be aborted.
